text: Old gnarly trees by our riverbank - great sunset company!
Gotta say nothing beats those sunrise moments while inspecting fields; it’s quiet except for nature waking up - really puts your mind at ease before bustling hours ahead.
Afternoon slow walks checking crops - underrated calmness there too.
Old town plaza's big shady trees - pure bliss!
Planning's one thing, life's curveballs another!
Mateo taught me long ago - harvests are like retirement plans; you predict all you want; still gotta adjust when it hits different.
Estate planning? Ha! More like infinite puzzles!
Nights on farm—quiet yet tough missing fam events.
Hit 30 farming; suddenly you're not just sowing seeds but planting roots deep – life stuff gets real fast!
Not just festivals – crops teach that lesson yearly!
Culture's just part; choices define us more.
